Interface TokenStorage

    public interface TokenStorage
    Provides storage for tokens used in the
    Author:

      • getExpiration

        int getExpiration(int desiredExpiration)
        Provides the expiration time for the tokens being provided. A desired expiration can be provided, but the storage can decide to override it with a different value.
        Parameters:
        desiredExpiration - desired expiration time.
        Returns:
        the expiration time of the token in seconds

      • getDefaultExpiration

        int getDefaultExpiration()
        Provides the default expiration time for the tokens being provided when a desired expiration is not provided.
        Returns:
        the expiration time of the token in seconds

      • store

        void store(IdToken idToken,
         IdTokenResponse idTokenResponse)

        Store the token response in the storage.

        It should use the TokenResponse.getAccessToken() and TokenResponse.getRefreshToken() to store the mapping for the access token and refresh token to the id token respectively. The splitting up logic was not done in TokenProvider to allow implementations of the TokenStorage that support composite key building. 

         accessTokenToTokenResponse.put(idTokenResponse.getAccessToken(), idTokenResponse);
 refreshTokenToTokenResponse.put(idTokenResponse.getRefreshToken(), idTokenResponse);
 Consent consent = new Consent(idToken, idTokenResponse);
 subjectAndClientIdToTokenResponse.put(consent, idTokenResponse);
        Parameters:
        idToken - id token
        idTokenResponse - token response to store

      • store

        void store(IdToken idToken,
         IdTokenResponse idTokenResponse,
         String code)

        Store the token response in the storage and add a code mapping for it.

        It should use the TokenResponse.getAccessToken() and TokenResponse.getRefreshToken() to store the mapping for the access token and refresh token to the id token respectively. The splitting up logic was not done in TokenProvider to allow implementations of the TokenStorage that support composite key building.

        This would generally call #store(IdTokenResponse) first followed by storing the code mapping.

        Parameters:
        idToken - id token
        idTokenResponse - token response to store
        code - code
